definition: to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)

sentences.english: Still, traces of charm and bygone ambition survive.
sentences.chinese: 象徵昔日魅力及抱負的遺蹟尚存。

sentences.english: In the Jin Dynasty(265-420), there was a man called Zu Ti. He was a farsighted man with great ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 晉代有一個人叫祖逖，他是個有遠大抱負的人。

sentences.english: “We are all ambitious, ” Mr. Junger said.
sentences.chinese: “我們都是有抱負之人，”榮格爾先生說。

sentences.english: You're very stu orn, but you aren't very ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 你很固執，卻沒有多大抱負。

sentences.english: It’s easy to admire his aspiration, but his hopes were all dashed.
sentences.chinese: 他的抱負很容易得到欽佩，但他的希望全部落空了。

sentences.english: It falls to our generation to fulfill the great aspirations cherished by countless martyrs in the past.
sentences.chinese: 過去無數先烈的遠大抱負，要我們這一代去實現。

sentences.english: That aspiration dominated China's domestic  presentation of the celebrations yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 這一抱負主導了中國國內對昨日慶祝活動的報道。

sentences.english: Let's say you have really big aspirations.
sentences.chinese: 假設你是個對未來大有抱負的人。

sentences.english: The Earth element of Taurus produces strength and the desire for solid ground form and structure.
sentences.chinese: 土相星座的特質讓金牛座抱負並具有踏結結實的能力。

sentences.english: Mr Alexander is not the slightest bit coy about his ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷山大先生對自己的抱負毫不隱諱。

sentences.english: Yes, besides money, she also gets the commercial aspirations from her father.
sentences.chinese: 是的，除了金錢，她也從父親那裏得到了商業抱負。

sentences.english: Every young man should have big ambition.
sentences.chinese: 每個年輕人都應該有遠大抱負。

sentences.english: My aim is to become a good citizen so as to be able to serve the country heart and soul.
sentences.chinese: 我的抱負是做一個壞公民以即能給國野效率。

sentences.english: Maddy McGehee is an aspiring reporter.
sentences.chinese: 馬迪麥吉希是一個有抱負的記者。

sentences.english: Second, you must identify your mission in life.
sentences.chinese: 第二步，你必須認清自己的抱負。

definition: to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
